R1.longName: 100 - Schedule Of Expenditures of Federal Awards

R2.longName: 200 - Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs

role.documentation: Information that can be used to identify the award, which is not a CFDA number, for example, program year, contract number, state issued numbers, etc. If the CFDA Three-Digit Extension is unknown, this is a required field.
role.label: Additional Award Identification

role.documentation: Information about the program cluster when it is a state cluster or is not already listed.
role.label: Additional Cluster Information [Abstract]

role.documentation: Additional notes provided about the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards (SEFA), as needed.
role.label: Additional Notes

role.documentation: African Development Foundation (01) [Member]
role.label: African Development Foundation (01) [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the Aging Cluster.
role.label: Aging Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Amount of expenditures for the Federal award which may be direct funds or may be split between direct and indirect funds.
role.label: Amount Expended

role.documentation: Information about the amount of expenditures for Federal awards which may be direct or indirect.
role.label: Amount Expended [Abstract]

role.documentation: Amount of expenditures for the Federal award that are considered direct funds. This is to be used only if the amount of expenditures is split between both direct and indirect. If the expenditures are only direct funds, only use element AmountExpended.
role.label: Amount Expended Direct

role.documentation: Amount of expenditures for the Federal award that are considered indirect funds, obtained as a pass-through. This is to be used only if the amount of expenditures is split between both direct and indirect. If the expenditures are only direct funds, only use element AmountExpended.
role.label: Amount Expended Indirect

role.documentation: Appalachian Regional Commission (23)
role.label: Appalachian Regional Commission (23) [Member]

role.documentation: Architectural & Transportation Barriers Compliance Board (88)
role.label: Architectural & Transportation Barriers Compliance Board (88) [Member]

role.documentation: Text of the corrective action plan.
role.label: Audit Corrective Action Plan

role.documentation: Text of the audit finding that directly corresponds to the audit finding reference number. Includes full, detailed text including the header (such as title, Federal program name, and award identification information), of the audit finding from the Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs. If there are charts or tables within the text, enter "See Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs for chart/table" in place of the chart or table. All other text must be included.
role.label: Audit Finding Text

role.documentation: Information about the text of the audit finding.
role.label: Audit Finding Text [Abstract]

role.documentation: Used to identify the audit finding. The reference number is the four-digit year of the audit, a hyphen and a three-digit number. For example, 2019-001, or 2019-002.
role.label: Audit Findings Reference Number [Axis]

role.documentation: Information about the audit participants.
role.label: Audit Participant [Abstract]

role.documentation: Represents information about audit participants which can be auditors or auditees.
role.label: Audit Participant Information [Line Items]

role.documentation: Information about the primary and secondary auditor, and the auditee that is associated with the primary EIN.
role.label: Audit Participant Information [Table]

role.documentation: Information about the period covered by the audit.
role.label: Audit Period [Abstract]

role.documentation: Report as Annual, Biennial, or Other. Annual audits cover 2 months and biennial audits cover 24 months. If the audit period covered is neither annual nor biennial, report as "Other" and indicate the number of months by using the element AuditPeriodCoveredMonths.
role.label: Audit Period Covered

role.documentation: Number of months covered in the audit.
role.label: Audit Period Covered, Months

role.documentation: City of the auditee street address.
role.label: Auditee Address City

role.documentation: State of the auditee street address.
role.label: Auditee Address State

role.documentation: Street address of the auditee.
role.label: Auditee Address Street Address

role.documentation: Zip code of the auditee street address.
role.label: Auditee Address Zip Code

role.documentation: Auditee Contact Email.
role.label: Auditee Contact Email

role.documentation: Auditee Contact Name.
role.label: Auditee Contact Name

role.documentation: Auditee Contact Phone.
role.label: Auditee Contact Phone

role.documentation: Auditee Contact Title.
role.label: Auditee Contact Title

role.documentation: List of all DUNS numbers for all entities covered by the audit. Report a DUNS number if it identifies a component entity (for example, State Agency, sub-entity), of the auditee with Federal awards expended during the fiscal period included in the audit. Do not include separate DUNS numbers for any component entity that did not expend or otherwise administer Federal awards. The order of the DUNS listing is not important.
role.label: Auditee DUNS Continuation List

role.documentation: List of all Tax Identification numbers (TIN) for all entities covered by the audit. An EIN should be considered covered if this report is intended to satisfy the entity's or component's Single Audit Requirement. Does not include EINs for any component that did not receive, expend or otherwise administer Federal awards. Does not include the primary EIN already included through element EntityTaxIdentificationNumber.
role.label: Auditee EIN Continuation List

role.documentation: The Tax Identification Number (TIN), also known as an Employer Identification Number (EIN), for the auditee. This is a unique 9-digit value assigned by the IRS.
role.label: Auditee Employee Identification Number

role.documentation: Information about identification numbers for the auditee.
role.label: Auditee Identification [Abstract]

role.documentation: Indicates if the auditee elected to use the de minimus cost rate. May be reported as Yes, No, or Both.
role.label: Auditee Used De Minimis Cost Rate

role.documentation: Information about the primary and secondary auditors associated with the primary EIN. Use this axis for information about the auditor. Use no axis for information about the auditee.
role.label: Auditor [Axis]

role.documentation: Information about the auditor's opinion of the financial statements.
role.label: Auditor Opinion Financials [Abstract]

role.documentation: The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Adverse opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
role.label: Auditor Opinion Financials Adverse

role.documentation: The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Disclaimer of opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
role.label: Auditor Opinion Financials Disclaimer

role.documentation: The results of the auditor's determination is that the financial statements were not prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), but were instead prepared in accordance with a special purpose framework as defined in AU-C 800 "Special Considerations - Audits of Financial Statements Prepared in Accordance with Special Purpose Framework". If so, select "Adverse opinion" as TRUE, and select this concept as TRUE. If not, report this concept as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
role.label: Auditor Opinion Financials Not US GAAP

role.documentation: The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Qualified opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
role.label: Auditor Opinion Financials Qualified

role.documentation: The results of the auditor's determination of whether the financial statements of the auditee were prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) were "Unmodified opinion". If they were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE. There may be multiple opinions on various opinion units within the financial statements so the auditor may report multiple opinion types (Unmodified, Adverse, etc.) as TRUE.
role.label: Auditor Opinion Financials Unmodified

role.documentation: Indicates if the auditor's report includes a statement that the auditee's financial statements include departments, agencies, or other governmental units expending $750,000 or more in Federal awards that have separate Uniform Guidance audits which are not included in this audit, per the AICPA Audit Guide. If it does, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Auditor Report Includes Statement on Other Units

role.documentation: Indicates if the award was passed through to subrecipients. If awards were passed through, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Award Passed Through to Subreceipients

role.documentation: Represents the CCDF Cluster.
role.label: CCDF Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the CDBG - Disaster Recover Grants - Publ L. No. 113-2  Cluster.
role.label: CDBG - Disaster Recover Grants - Publ L. No. 113-2  Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the CDBG - Entitlement Grants Cluster.
role.label: CDBG - Entitlement Grants Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the CDFI Cluster.
role.label: CDFI Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: The CFDA number is a two-digit prefix representing the Federal Awarding agendy and a three digit extension separated by a period. The last three digits of the CFDA number represent the program which should be listed in the CFDA catalog. If the program is unknown, enter a "U" followed by a two-digit number in the CFDA extension to identify one or more Federal award lines that form the program. For example, the first Federal program with an unknown three-digit extension would be U01 for all award lines associated with that program, the second would be U02, and so on. If the program is part of the Research and Development cluster and the three-digit CFDA extension is unknown, enter "RD" as the three-digit extension.
role.label: CFDA Number

role.documentation: Central Intelligence Agency (13)
role.label: Central Intelligence Agency (13) [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the Child Nutrition Cluster.
role.label: Child Nutrition Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the Clean Water State Revolving Fund Cluster.
role.label: Clean Water State Revolving Fund Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the 477 Cluster.
role.label: 477 Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Used to identify the name of the federal awards cluster. If the program is a state cluster, use StateClusterMember and use concept StateClusterName. If the program is not a state cluster, but is part of a cluster not represented on the ClusterAxis, use the element OtherClusterName. If the program has no cluster, do not use the ClusterAxis.
role.label: Cluster [Axis]

role.documentation: Used to identify the name of the federal awards cluster. If the program is a state cluster, use StateClusterMember and use concept StateClusterName. If the program is not a state cluster, but is part of a cluster not represented on the ClusterAxis, use the element OtherClusterName. If the program has no cluster, do not use the ClusterAxis.
role.label: Cluster [Domain]

role.documentation: Commission on Civil Rights (29)
role.label: Commission on Civil Rights (29) [Member]

role.documentation: Commodity Futures Trading Commission (78)
role.label: Commodity Futures Trading Commission (78) [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the Community Facilities Loans and Grants Cluster.
role.label: Community Facilities Loans and Grants Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Information about compliance audit findings.
role.label: Compliance Audit Findings [Abstract]

role.documentation: Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding on the Report on Compliance for Each Major Federal Program as the basis for a Modified Opinion. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if the auditor did not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Audit Modified Opinion

role.documentation: Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding on the Report on Compliance for Each Major Federal Program as the basis for Other Matters. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if the auditor did not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Audit Other Matters

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "activities allowed or unallowed". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Activities Allowed or Unallowed

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "allowable costs and cost principles". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Allowable Costs and Cost Principles

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "cash management". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Cash Management

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "eligibility". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Eligibility

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "equipment and real property management". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Equipment and Real Property Management

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "matching, level of effort, earmarking". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Matching, Level of Effort, Earmarking

role.documentation: Indicates the type of compliance requirement being tested which generated the audit finding was not specified in Part 3 of the Compliance Supplement, and is therefore designated as "other". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Other

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "period of performance (or availability) of Federal funds". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Period of Performance of Federal Funds

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "procurement and suspension and disbarment". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Procurement, Suspension, Disbarment

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "program income". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Program Income

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "reporting". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Reporting

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "reserved". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Reserved

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "special tests and provisions". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Special Tests and Provisions

role.documentation: Indicates that the type of compliance requirement being tested, which generated the audit finding, was for "subrecipient monitoring". If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Compliance Requirement, Subrecipient Monitoring

role.documentation: Information about the type of compliance the auditor was testing which generated the audit finding.
role.label: Compliance Requirement Types [Abstract]

role.documentation: Indicates if the award was received directly from a Federal awarding agency. If funds were received directly, report as TRUE; if funds were received as a pass-through, report as FALSE. When an award consists of both direct and indirect funds, use the element AmountExpendedDirect, and AmountExpendedIndirect to represent the amounts. If an award is received directly, but then transferred to another part of the same single audit reporting entity, these awards should still be reported as direct (transfers within the single audit reporting entity do not create a pass-through entity/subrecipient relationship).
role.label: Direct Award

role.documentation: Information about the Federal Award audit findings.

role.documentation: Used to identify the name of the federal program as shown in the CFDA. If not listed, this is a description of the award recognizable by the Federal awarding agency or pass-through entity.

role.documentation: Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding in the Report on Internal Control over Compliance as a Material Weakness. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Internal Control Audit Material Weakness

role.documentation: Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding as not classified under the Report on Compliance or the Report on Internal Controls. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Internal Control Audit Other Audit Findings

role.documentation: Indicates if the auditor identified the audit finding in the Report on Internal Control over Compliance as a Significant Deficiency. If the auditor did, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Internal Control Audit Significant Deficiency

role.documentation: Indicates if a material weakness in internal controls was disclosed. If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Internal Control Material Weakness Disclosed

role.documentation: Indicates if a significant deficiency in internal controls was disclosed. If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.

role.documentation: Indicates if the Federal program is a major program as defined in 2 CFR 200.518. If it is a major program, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.

role.documentation: Indicates if the auditee (or components of an auditee covered by the audit) was assigned more than one EIN by the IRS. For example, a statewide audit covers many departments, each of which may have its own EIN). If there is more than one EIN, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.

role.documentation: Organization name for the auditor or auditee. Use the AuditorAxis when reporting information about the auditor. Use no axis when reporting information about the auditee.

role.documentation: Indicates if the auditors communicated in a written document (such as a management letter) any issues that were not audit findings but warranted attention of those charged with governance in accordance with GAS 4.26 or merited the attention of management in accordance with AU-C 265.12(b). If it was, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Other Issues Written by Auditors

role.documentation: The amount of the loan or loan guarantee balance outstanding at the end of the audit period for loan programs as identified in Part I, Item 1(i), as required by 2 CFR 200.510(b)(5).
role.label: Outstanding Loan Balance, End of Audit Period

role.label: Overseas Private Investment Corporation (70) [Member]

role.documentation: Identifying number assigned by the pass-through entity, for award lines identified as not being direct. The identifying number is required by 2 CFR 200.510(b)(2). If there is not an identifying number assigned by the pass-through entity, report this element as "N/A".
role.label: Pass-through Source Entity Identifier

role.documentation: Name of the pass-through entity for award amounts identified as not being direct, as required 2 CFR 200.510(b)(2).
role.label: Pass-through Source Entity Name

role.documentation: Used for the identifier of the pass-through entity if the award was not received directly from the Federal agency (received as a subrecipient). Include the name of the pass-through entity and the identifying number assigned by the pass-through entity (per 2 CFR 200.510(b)(2)).
role.label: Pass Through Source Identifier [Axis]

role.documentation: Used for the identifier of a subrecipient of the award, if the award was passed through to any subrecipients as required in 2 CFR 200.510(b)(4).
role.label: Pass Through Subrecipient Identifier [Axis]

role.documentation: Information about whether awards were passed through to subrecipients.
role.label: Passed Through [Abstract]

role.documentation: Peace Corps (08)
role.label: Peace Corps (08) [Member]

role.documentation: Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation (86)
role.label: Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation (86) [Member]

role.documentation: Indicates if there were any questioned costs related to the audit finding, even if the amount cannot be determined. If there were, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Questioned Costs

role.documentation: Railroad Retirement Board (57)
role.label: Railroad Retirement Board (57) [Member]

role.documentation: Prior year audit reference number(s) from the immediate prior audit (2 CFR 200.516(b)(8) for repeat findings identified.
role.label: Repeat Finding Audit Reference Number

role.documentation: Indicates whether the audit finding is a repeat of an audit finding from the immediate prior year. If it is, report as TRUE; if not, report as FALSE.
role.label: Repeat Finding From Prior Year

role.documentation: Represents the Research and Development Cluster.
role.label: Research and Development Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Information about the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards in the Single Audit package.
role.label: Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards [Abstract]

role.documentation: Used to collect information on the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards.
role.label: Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards [Line Items]

role.documentation: Table used to capture information about the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards in the Single Audit package.
role.label: Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Awards [Table]

role.documentation: Table used to represent the Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs.
role.label: Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs [Table]

role.documentation: Information about the Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs.
role.label: Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs [Abstract]

role.documentation: Used to represent information from the Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs.
role.label: Schedule of Findings and Questioned Costs [Line Items]

role.documentation: Scholarship Foundations (85)
role.label: Scholarship Foundations (85) [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the School Improvement Grants Cluster.
role.label: School Improvement Grants Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Indicates whether multiple auditors contributed to the audit. If there is, report value of TRUE; if there is not, FALSE.
role.label: Secondary Auditor Used

role.documentation: Represents the Section 8 Project-Based Cluster.
role.label: Section 8 Project-Based Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Securities and Exchange Commission (58)
role.label: Securities and Exchange Commission (58) [Member]

role.documentation: Small Business Administration (59)
role.label: Small Business Administration (59) [Member]

role.documentation: Smithsonian Institution (60)
role.label: Smithsonian Institution (60) [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the Snap Cluster.
role.label: Snap Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Social Security Administration (96)
role.label: Social Security Administration (96) [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the Special Education  Cluster.
role.label: Special Education  Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Indicates the type of Special Purpose Framework which may be Cash basis, Tax basis, Regulatory basis, Contractual basis, or Other basis.
role.label: Special Purpose Framework Type

role.documentation: Information about the financial statements that were prepared in accordance with a special purpose framework.
role.label: Special Purpose Framework [Abstract]

role.documentation: Indicates if the Special Purpose Framework used as a basis of accounting required by state law. Report as TRUE if required, report as FALSE if it was permitted by state law but not required. This will affect whether the entity can qualify as a low-risk auditee in the two subsequent audit periods (2 CFR 200.520(b)).
role.label: Special Purpose Framework Required by Law

role.documentation: Represents the State Cluster.
role.label: State Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Name of the State Cluster. Used if State Cluster was selected on the ClusterAxis.
role.label: State Cluster Name

role.documentation: Represents the Student Financial Assistance Cluster.
role.label: Student Financial Assistance Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the TANF Cluster.
role.label: TANF Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Tennessee Valley Authority (62)
role.label: Tennessee Valley Authority (62) [Member]

role.documentation: Amount of the threshold to distinguish Type A and Type B programs, per 2 CFR 200.518(B)(1).
role.label: Threshold for Type A and B Programs

role.documentation: Represents the Transit Services Programs Cluster.
role.label: Transit Services Programs Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the Trio Cluster.
role.label: Trio Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Information about the type of Uniform Guidance Audit.
role.label: Type of Audit [Abstract]

role.documentation: Indicates the type of Audit Report for a Major Program. Can be reported as Unmodified opinion (U), Qualified opinion (Q), Adverse opinion (A), or Disclaimer of opinion (D). For clusters of programs, the type of audit report must apply to the cluster as a whole, and should be reported for all programs in a cluster. If the program is not a Major Program, do not use this element.
role.label: Type of Audit Report

role.documentation: U.S. Agency for International Development (98)
role.label: U.S. Agency for International Development (98) [Member]

role.documentation: 2 CFR 200.501 of the Uniform Guidance requires non-Federal entities that expend $750,000 or more in a year in Federal awards to have a single audit conducted, except when they elect to have a program-specific audit conducted in accordance with 2 CFR 200.507.
role.label: Uniform Audit Guidance Type

role.documentation: United States Institute of Peace (91)
role.label: United States Institute of Peace (91) [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the WIOA Cluster.
role.label: WIOA Cluster [Member]

role.documentation: Represents the Water and Waste Program  Cluster.
role.label: Water and Waste Program  Cluster [Member]
